resources.string: The stock is experiencing heavy trading volume on an up day. Indicates its being purchased by the big money managers.
The stock is experiencing light trading volume on a down day. Indicates its being purchased by the big money managers.
The stock is experiencing heavy trading volume on a down day. Indicates its being sold by the big money managers.
The stock is experiencing light trading volume on an up day. Indicates its being sold by the big money managers.
The stock has hit its highest closing price in the last 60 days. Indicates a possible positive trend change.
The stock has hit its lowest price in the last 90 days. Indicates a possible negative trend change.
The stock is trading above its 200 day moving average. Signals a possible bull trend.
The stock is trading below its 200 day moving average. Signals a possible bear trend.
The stocks closing price has increased for 10 straight days. Indicates a possible positive breakout.
A PEG value greater than 2 signals a high valuation.

The stop loss defines the maximum percentage loss that is acceptable before a stock should be sold. A trailing stop loss protects gains by triggering when a stock closes the specified percentage below its highest price.
The stock is trading below its 50 day moving average indicating a momentum shift towards a bear trend.
